page.title: 17Museums
page.content: The Alexander Keiller museum in Avebury houses exhibits that represent daily life around Avebury 5000 years ago. It contains a particularly impressive exhibition of skeletons. The huge 17th century barn fell into disuse with the breaking up of the Manor estate early this century. In 1979 the Great Barn was opened to the public,after being fully restored, as the museum of {The Wiltshire Folk {Life Society}. An old cow shed next to the barn has recently been converted into an educational centre. Nine apprentices from a local construction company have carried out the work which took them three months.Each apprentice had a specialist trade although everyone mucked in and helped. A plaque was unveiled and each of the apprentices were given a tankard at the handing over ceremony.
